[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/keys.rs] [Type: DealtSecretKey] [Zero value attack] Can a DealtSecretKey be set to zero (since it's just a Scalar), creating a trivial secret that breaks the security of the DKG protocol? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/keys.rs] [Trait: ValidCryptoMaterial] [Protocol integration] The ValidCryptoMaterial trait (lines 24-32) integrates with the broader Aptos crypto system - can mismatches in serialization formats between different crypto material types cause protocol failures? [File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/keys.rs] [Function: to()] [Parameter injection] The to() method (lines 67-71) takes a reference to PublicParameters - can a Byzantine validator provide a reference to malicious parameters they control, affecting other validators' key derivation? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/keys.rs] [Generic: E: Pairing] [Curve choice] The code is generic over any Pairing implementation - does this allow usage with weak or deprecated elliptic curve pairings (like supersingular curves) that have known attacks? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/keys.rs] [Struct: EncryptPubKey] [G1 vs G2 confusion] EncryptPubKey uses G1Affine (line 21) while DealtPubKey uses G2Affine (line 78) - can confusion between these groups lead to type errors that break pairing-based proofs? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/keys.rs] [Field: ek] [Comment accuracy] The comment on line 19 says 'H^{dk^{-1}}' (dk inverse) but the to() method computes 'H * dk' (not inverse) - is this a cryptographic design flaw or just a documentation error? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/keys.rs] [Trait: Pairing] [Pairing assumption] Does the security rely on the hardness of the decisional Diffie-Hellman assumption in pairing groups, and are there parameter choices that could weaken this assumption? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/keys.rs] [Struct: DecryptPrivKey] [Thread safety] DecryptPrivKey does not implement Send or Sync - could this prevent proper usage in async validator code, forcing unsafe workarounds? (Medium)
